titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Rice University Shell Center for Sustainability records, 2003-2017 UA 393

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2022-04-02 13:40:09 -0500.

did.head: Collection Summary

repository.corpname: Woodson Research Center, Rice University, Houston, Texas

did.unittitle: Rice University Shell Center for Sustainability records
did.abstract: This collection contains the administrative files, meeting minutes and records, publications, audio/visual (DVDs) presentations, and reports for the Rice University Shell Center for Sustainability.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: Rice University and Shell Oil Company launched the Shell Center for Sustainability (SCS) in 2002. The Center is housed in the School of Social Sciences and collaborates with other centers and institutes at Rice University. SCS works closely with schools and organizations within the campus and beyond forging multidisciplinary teams and partnerships. The SCS uses the Gulf of Mexico, the state of Texas, and the Houston and Galveston region as research models.

The Shell Center for Sustainability's mission is to foster an interdisciplinary program of research, outreach, and education to address actions that can be taken to ensure the sustainable development of communities' living standards, interpreted broadly, to encompass all factors affecting the overall quality of life.

scopecontent.head: Content Description
scopecontent.p: This collection contains the administrative files, meeting minutes and records, publications, audio/visual (DVDs) presentations, and reports for the Rice University Shell Center for Sustainability.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Collection open for research without restrictions, except for certain materials in the Finance sub-series and the Human Resources sub-series, which are restricted from all viewing and use until 2050.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Stored off-site at the Library Service Center. Please request this material via woodson@rice.edu or call 713-348-2586.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: This material was transferred by Lilibeth Andre in 2017.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Rice University Shell Center for Sustainability Records, 2003-2017, UA 393, Woodson Research Center, Fondren Library, Rice University

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Permission to publish material from the Rice University Shell Center for Sustainability Records must be obtained from the Woodson Research Center, Fondren Library.
